alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 9:18AM EDT until June 26 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... East central Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1000 AM EDT. * At 917 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Gilbert, or 14 miles east of Lehighton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, East Bangor, Stormville, Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Millbrook, Skytop, Tannersville, Long Pond, Kresgeville, Sun Valley, Reeders, Saylorsburg, McMichael and Canadensis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 288 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 12. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
